Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis; interior glazed black (fired partly red); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of female figures and siren (of the two confronting females, only draped lower bodies remaining with added red; of siren, head and rear of body missing; red on chest) to left.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see the lidless lekanis in the Wuarin collection in Geneva (ABV, 45, no. 42; Dorig, J., Art Antique, Collections privées de Suisse Romande. Mainz 1975, no.158a and b; Add. 2, 12). The sherd possibly belongs to the same vessel as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.128.39.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.26)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 151, note 67)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 226, no.1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 334, no. B389)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0776) (Phase 1)
